update.description: This adds two more examples: `core_no_deps` and `core_child`. Both of these create a core library from a single `empty.cc` file. The `core_child` package depends on `core_no_deps` and links its core library with `PUBLIC`, so it should be listed in in the `Requires` section of the pkg-config file. This is currently broken (to be fixed by pull request #56), so you can confirm that the test fails.

content.raw:
You're right; I was able to confirm the warning occurs on the `ign-math4` windows build with `RelWithDebInfo`:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-windows7-amd64&build=12)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-windows7-amd64/12/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-windows7-amd64/12/warnings42Result/

(I did need to use a special release-tools branch to set the build type properly: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/557/pass-build_type-to-configurebat/diff )
content.html:
You're right; I was able to confirm the warning occurs on the ign-math4 windows build with RelWithDebInfo:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-windows7-amd64/12/warnings42Result/

(I did need to use a special release-tools branch to set the build type properly: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/557/pass-build_type-to-configurebat/diff )

content.raw:
This is a warning that gets triggered in all our ignition projects' Windows builds. It's caused by passing the `/GL` flag to a build that also has some debug flags (i.e. `RelWithDebInfo`). Some debug flags seem to automatically trigger `/INCREMENTAL`, which conflicts with `/GL`.

I've attempted to suppress this warning by explicitly adding `/INCREMENTAL:NO` to our command line flags, but that didn't seem to help. As far as I can tell, the only way to prevent this warning from printing is to not use `/GL` on our `RelWithDebInfo` builds. I don't know enough about linker optimization to judge whether that's a good, bad, or neutral idea.
content.html:
This is a warning that gets triggered in all our ignition projects' Windows builds. It's caused by passing the /GL flag to a build that also has some debug flags (i.e. RelWithDebInfo). Some debug flags seem to automatically trigger /INCREMENTAL, which conflicts with /GL.

I've attempted to suppress this warning by explicitly adding /INCREMENTAL:NO to our command line flags, but that didn't seem to help. As far as I can tell, the only way to prevent this warning from printing is to not use /GL on our RelWithDebInfo builds. I don't know enough about linker optimization to judge whether that's a good, bad, or neutral idea.

content.raw:
Thanks for the fix! There is now a windows linker warning for the `RelWithDebInfo` examples that Jenkins picks up:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/71/warningsResult/

~~~
LINK Pass 1:
C:\PROGRA~2\MIB055~1\2017\COMMUN~1\VC\Tools\MSVC\1411~1.255\bin\Hostx86\x64\link.exe /nologo @CMakeFiles\ignition-core_no_deps.dir\objects1.rsp /out:..\bin\ignition-core_no_deps.dll /implib:..\lib\ignition-core_no_deps.lib /pdb:D:\Jenkins\workspace\ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64\ws\ign-cmake\build\examples\core_no_deps_RelWithDebInfo-prefix\src\core_no_deps_RelWithDebInfo-build\bin\ignition-core_no_deps.pdb /dll /version:0.1 /machine:x64 /debug /INCREMENTAL kernel32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib winspool.lib shell32.lib ole32.lib oleaut32.lib uuid.lib comdlg32.lib advapi32.lib /MANIFEST /MANIFESTFILE:CMakeFiles\ignition-core_no_deps.dir/intermediate.manifest CMakeFiles\ignition-core_no_deps.dir/manifest.res
AlmostEmpty.cc.obj : MSIL .netmodule or module compiled with /GL found; restarting link with /LTCG; add /LTCG to the link command line to improve linker performance
LINK : warning LNK4075: ignoring '/INCREMENTAL' due to '/LTCG' specification
   Creating library ..\lib\ignition-core_no_deps.lib and object ..\lib\ignition-core_no_deps.exp
Generating code
Finished generating code
~~~

  references the file

     "D:/Jenkins/workspace/ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/ws/ign-cmake/build/install/Release/lib/ignition-core_no_deps.lib"

  but this file does not exist.  Possible reasons include:

  * The file was deleted, renamed, or moved to another location.

  * An install or uninstall procedure did not complete successfully.

  * The installation package was faulty and contained

     "D:/Jenkins/workspace/ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/ws/ign-cmake/build/install/Release/lib/cmake/ignition-core_no_deps/ignition-core_no_deps-targets.cmake"

any ideas @mxgrey ?

it looks like there's a race condition during install that can make it fail:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/57/console

~~~
CMake Error at src/cmake_install.cmake:64 (file):
  file INSTALL cannot copy file
  "/Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/build/examples/core_no_deps_RelWithDebInfo-prefix/src/core_no_deps_RelWithDebInfo-build/cmake/ignition-core_no_deps-config-version.cmake"
  to
  "/Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_cmake-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/build/install/lib/cmake/ignition-core_no_deps/ignition-core_no_deps-config-version.cmake".
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  cmake_install.cmake:64 (include)
~~~
